website_summaries.verdict: The Kong ball is a reliable toy for games of catch, or for solo chew time.
pros: Has a safety-feature hole to allow your dog to breathe if the toy accidentally gets swallowed
Comes in a 2.5-inch small size for little dogs
This ball is perfect for playing catch
cons: A little on the small side compared to others at only 3-inches in diameter for medium and large dogs

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs that are tough on their toys.
customer_reviews.text: My 15mo dog had it for 30 minutes before he managed to get chunks out of it. I'm returning as the Kong packaging stated 30 money back guarantee, simply return to retailer for refund. I bought this because a friend, who boards dogs, has this ball and it barely has a dent in it. Her ball is solid, the ones I recieved have the holes through the middle. Though this didn't seem to be the sole weak point of this "toughest rubber" ball. The regular Kong Extreme lasted a few days longer than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: LBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great dog toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog on a whim while ordering dog food. He normally favors the rubber chuck-it balls, but since this arrived it has been his go-to for fetch. It's solid, so he hasn't been able to make even a slight dent in it yet (and he is a power chewer). The only downside is that it is really heavy! Don't let your dog drop it on your foot when he brings it back. You'll regret it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Mags MacD

customer_reviews.title: Delivered October 23rd, already DESTROYED
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs in the 70 pound range that like to chew, 1 more aggressively than the other. I bought these Kong, aggressive chewer, balls to try to give them something durable to chew on but I had to throw one away already, because a major portion of it was GONE already. I just don't get paying $13.99 to get a supposed "Aggressive" chewer toy, that is allegedly made to last, only to have it destroyed in 3 weeks. Don't bother, these are NOT pitbull worthy.
customer_reviews.author: bookemin1103

customer_reviews.title: NOWHERE NEAR indestructible
customer_reviews.text: I hate when products are defined as extreme or indestructible and they last 2 days! I have an extreme chewer and this ball lasts 2-3 days before it becomes 1/2 of a ball. The only reason I have purchased this ball more times than I can count is because one of my furbabies has been severely attached to having a ball since she was in the animal rescue shelter, it is her security blanket. When these balls were made without a hole, they were close to earning an extreme description but the hole lets our baby exploit the ball and turn it into pieces of rubber.
customer_reviews.author: HD boy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy solid ball- not fun for play
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy, solid bowling ball for my dog. He hates it. I hate it. I am afraid to throw it in my house as I think it would damage my drywall. My lab lives every single ball in the whole world, it when I throw this one, he doesn't even bother to get up. It will last forever as my dog will never play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: great pittie  toys
customer_reviews.text: this is a great toy for power chewers. however if i had thought about it more i would not have chosen black. it is hard to find in dark places. also since it is hard rubber, it gets wet and slippery, it is fun to watch my Pitties chase it when it slips out of their mouths and yes i don't have to throw it a lot, but when it slips under furniture, i have to crawl on the floor to get it. then they all gang up on me to see who gets it first. i like the other Kong designs better.
customer_reviews.author: lance doggette

customer_reviews.title: This is the toy for your super, super chewer
customer_reviews.text: My pup is notorious for destroying "indestructible" toys. I could not tell you how many toys I've returned with guarantees to not break, there have been so many over the past two years. She is a purebred gottiline American bulldog. THIS BALL PASSED THE TEST. She's had it about 6 months at time of this review. There are a few pieces she's managed to tear out but they are small and the ball is still a ball. She plays with it several days a week. Every other Kong toy I've gotten, she has torn up but not this one. I am very, very pleased to see that it has held up for months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KONG Ball
customer_reviews.text: Hesitant to post a review too soon. Bought for 1.5 year old GSD who thinks ball is life. He is also a power chewer. His bones were scratching our floors so we opted for this thing. Now, it does bounce (off our floor, off our walls, off his head), but hasn't put a hole in our drywall yet. He entertains himself by knocking it down the stairs, goes to get it, runs back up, and does it again. He has put a few teeth marks in it, which is to be expected, but I say it's definitely worth the money. Will buy another if he loses or damages this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shannabanana

customer_reviews.title: finally a ball my dog didn't destroy
customer_reviews.text: We have a Pit Bull and she LOVES to chew and gnaw. Every single ball she has been given has been demolished in less than 60 seconds. I hesitated to spend $15 on a ball for my dog because if she destroyed it like the others, that's an expensive 60 seconds. lol Anyways, she's been at this ball for 3 days now and have been gnawing for several hours each day and has yet to even put a scratch in it. She's loving this ball and I'm loving the fact it's lasting so long. Definitely worth a try for your heavy chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a chewer. Even though he's only 15 lbs, he can damage toys that are too soft (we don't buy anything with squeakers or stuffing). My dog also loves balls, so this kong ball is perfect for him. He loves to run after it, pounce on it and even play fetch by himself with it. The only warning I have is to be careful when putting treats in this ball (even though there's a hole for it). My dog damaged his first kong ball after the treats broke off inside the ball and he chewed the rubber repeatedly trying to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: starzzzy

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 10 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy the Extreme Kong and that one lasts my dog a while. He is a 55lb Catahoula and definitely an extremely strong chewer. I wanted to try the ball version of the same series but unfortunately as soon as he put it in his mouth, his top canine tooth went right into the rubber and got stuck. I noticed him pawing at his mouth. It took me a minute to actually get his tooth out of the rubber and out of his mouth. He still has all his teeth but just a heads up it could be dangerous or a choking hazard for a dog left unattended with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: I

customer_reviews.title: Where have you gone?
customer_reviews.text: Not Kong's fault at all...but I purchased this and the first day I gave it to my dogs...was the last time I saw it. Where, oh where have you gone Kong ball? I need you. My girls need you. :-( So my response isn't quite in direct review of the ball, but Kong products have been pretty dang amazing. I have a pit bull who is notorious for chewing through basically anything. (I am pretty sure she would eat clear through me if I died in the same room as her). Kong products have been the only products that she has had to take her time getting through.
customer_reviews.author: Serena valley

customer_reviews.title: Our dog has trouble picking it up in her mouth ( and she's pretty big- it's just so heavy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is soooo heavy it's almost comical. Our dog has trouble picking it up in her mouth ( and she's pretty big- it's just so heavy!) and when you toss it for fetch it sounds like you're throwing a small bowling ball on the wood floor. So it's not good for fetch & it's too big for her to get her mouth around to chew it. It's basically useless to our pup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of two toys or Welsh Terrier has not destroyed
customer_reviews.text: It has been a few weeks now and this is one item our Welsh Terrier has not been able to destroy. The size is good for him. I don't know how, but he can get all of the peanut butter out of the center of it. The ball is heavy, but El Terrorista has no problem tossing it around the house. He cannot catch it because it would hurt him. It is not like a tennis ball. So far no complaints, and it keeps him entertained. Note: The slobber on this slick ball is gross.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Bouncy bouncy!
customer_reviews.text: Want your dog to know what it's like chasing Tigger? Well this ball will let them find out just that. I was extremely surprised when I bounced it originally and it rocketed up to my face. My face is okay still, thankfully, in case you were wondering. My ball has the hole but that's okay for now. The dog loves it. It's pretty heavy, seems strong, and has one hell of a bounce. Overall, seems like a solid product ( pun intended since it's not actually solid) and I'm happy with it. Only downside is that it's slippery as hell when there's slobber on it but that's okay.
customer_reviews.author: RoDagger

customer_reviews.title: His favorite ball now!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every dollar, my pitbull/shepherd loves it so much! I appreciate it's heft, I can toss it underhand and it's weight makes it travel. I gave myself "tennis elbow" using a Chuckit, this ball is so much easier to throw. It does not go as far, but it's weight and density tires my pup out quicker than the lighter squishy balls. He actually dances with it, tossing his head and jumping around in pure joy! It's the only ball I have been able leave with him after fetch games: tennis balls last 30secs while Chuckit Max balls last about 5 minutes unattended. His Kong ball isn't even dented after a week. BUY THIS BALL IF YOU HAVE A PITTIE!
customer_reviews.author: PrettyFunkyPunky

customer_reviews.title: Best ball ever! Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Love the extreme kong products! This is my heelers favorite toy! I only had to get a new one because he lost his other one that we had for 3 years. He had some chips out of it from chewing for 3 years, but nothing significant. Its stays outside in all the elements all year long. I ended up finding it, in the house, under the recliner the same day the new one came in. Lol. Now he has 2! We also have the kong extreme bone and the kong extreme. The ball is his most favorite though.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for aggressive chewer!
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the only ball my dog has not destroyed and he is a very aggressive chewer. After purchasing several balls this is the only one that has lasted and he has tried his best to destroy it with no luck so far. Ball is a little heavy, but he seems to like it. Highly recommend this ball. Might buy another if they offered more color options other than the black one. Stop wasting your money on the other balls and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Ya gotta read this...
customer_reviews.text: The 1st photo I submitted was of Gracie Mae, Pit Bull from nose to toes, and the new basketball she had been given not 10 seconds before that photo was taken. SHE ANNIHILATES EVERYTHING IN SECONDS...but she hasn't put a dent in the Kong black rubber ball. She loves it! She should be a product tester. She's worked on the tmKong ball FOR MONTHS! no shit. Buy it. Buy 2 cuz they're easy to lose...but worth the price! Gracie Mae Love-Tillman approved...I threw the other photos in just to show you she ain't no joke.. ain't she just the purtiest?
customer_reviews.author: Susan Love

customer_reviews.title: I figured the price wasn’t bad at all for this so I ordered it
customer_reviews.text: My dog Hector spend the moment he wakes up until the moment he goes to sleep chewing non stop. Anything he an chew he will try. (Broken IPhone, time teddy bears, and destroyed furniture) I’ve tried many different products and toys to keep him entertained but most are awful quality and destroyed with in minutes. I figured the price wasn’t bad at all for this so I ordered it. My lab loves it!!!! He’s been chewing on it for the past two days and it’s holding up very well. He has been so obsessed with this toy he hasn’t destroyed anything else for days. Will definitely be reordering
customer_reviews.author: Chacha123

customer_reviews.title: Best toy so far
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of KONG toys as well as other toys. My pit usually rips toys up in days if not faster. The original KONG (red) has lasted us over 5 months now and still going. This black ball I am reviewing seems to be even more durable than the traditional Kong. It is solid but it has a hole that goes through it. It’s heavy and you know it when you bounce it on the floor. This has been his favorite toy so far.
customer_reviews.author: uthe

customer_reviews.title: Great and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Have a foster pittbull / maybe boxer mix and he loves playing with balls. They are his absolute favorite. He has a very strong jaw and has destroyed several toys very quickly (under 15 min on some and 45 min on others). I gave the kong ball to him yesterday and he played with it for about 2.5 hours nonstop and not a dent. Will get another one if he ever destroys his original one. Its a little pricey but since it lasts, i am happy and so is Harley.
customer_reviews.author: Tiggerxt1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a pitbull
customer_reviews.text: This is a product I buy regularly for my dog. My pittie is a super chewer and he loves to fetch. This is the only ball/toy that last more than a few minutes, hours if I am lucky. If you have a super chewer, you know what I am talking about! I replace them every few months because eventually he does get some gouges in it and it can collect bacteria at that point. He loves it, it's long lasting, we are both happy.
customer_reviews.author: Salon Bohemia

customer_reviews.title: The dog is crazy over this ball!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the dog's favorite toy! He loves it because he can carry it in his mouth without swallowing it and, if he brings it to me and drops it, I throw it for him to chase! He has "buried" it under my sofa and then when he can't reach it, he lays on the floor crying until I get it out for him. Then he gets so excited, as if he's just gotten a new toy! The dog is crazy over this ball!
customer_reviews.author: Trula

customer_reviews.title: Holds up really well
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have purchased. We have an extreme chewer, a year and a half old boxer mix. The first ball lasted almost 8 months before she got big chucks out of it. I'm very impressed with how well it held up, only reason I didnt give it 5 stars is because once she got a chunk out of it it became an easier endeavor for her to get more chunks out of it. I will still continue to buy this ball for her because it keeps her busy and it was good for such a long period of time.
customer_reviews.author: EllieA

customer_reviews.title: It's lasted a week, but my dog doesn't like it much.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my German Shepard chews through any other ball in under 5 minutes, even to play catch!! She didn't like the ball at first, it still is not her favorite. It is heavy and she doesn't like that it doesn't squeak. It's really too heavy for catch, doesn't go as far or bounce well due to the weight of it. It's been a week and it's still around though.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Spiotti

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toy my dog can't destroy!
customer_reviews.text: My dog can and will destroy every toy we buy for her. The one and only exceptions is the "traditional" king toy. Since she has a fixation on stealing my kid's bouncy ball collection I thought this would be a good pick and so far so good! She loves this ball because it's super bounce and shoots all over the place when she tosses it. She really does enjoy playing with it! She hasn't YET to figure out how to tear it apart and it's been a week so that is a new record! The fact that it wasn't in the garbage can after 24 hours speak volumes! I had faith Kong would deliver, and I wasn't disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Pozonivy

customer_reviews.title: Decent ball with longevity
customer_reviews.text: Hmm, interesting. I tried to review the Kong red flyer and was flagged with this: Sorry, we are unable to accept your review of this product. Your previous review of this product did not comply with our Customer Reviews Guidelines. Amazon does not permit reviews from customers whose relationship to the product or seller may be perceived as biased. Wonder why? Well this is a decent ball and they last a good long time. Funny they let me review this, must have not liked my other review so flagged me. That sounds like a 1st amendment violation to me. Shame on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Woodmeister

customer_reviews.title: Eliminate the hole and it would last longer!
customer_reviews.text: Product came fast; however it was shipped in a cardboard box which could easily carry a lot more items. Our border collie is a ball killer in the first degree. We have tried many if not nearly all the big names advertising in indestructible balls, but none last more than a week or two. This is the 2nd or 3rd Kong extreme ball we have owned in the last year. After 2 weeks our dog has finally started nipping small pieces off of it. This is likely because the ball has a hole for treats. If they could eliminate or have the option to have a ball without a hole I think it could hold up for much longer.
customer_reviews.author: It's Chuck Norse

customer_reviews.title: A Staple of the Dog Toybox
customer_reviews.text: This is my third time buying this ball - one ball disappeared, the other has become our go to "dog park" ball - and it is an absolute STAPLE in my household. My dog is an aggressive chewer (60lb Pointer), to the point where most balls only last her an hour, tops. We bought this ball, hoping that it would last her a month or so. She has yet to destroy a single one, or even make progress towards destroying it. The ball is sturdy, it is a good size for a bigger dog, and it bounces and rolls just as well as a tennis ball! Would recommend to all dog parents.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wheeles

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for determined chewers
customer_reviews.text: My dog is an extreme chewer and would tear apart all stuffed animals, tennis balls and other toys we would give her. This ball became a lifesaver and Is still going strong. She has made some marks and dents into it but overall the ball is still in good condition. It is a noisy chew, but I much rather would hear her chewing on something like this and I know she is fine then have to panic about her eating stuffing or other material that could cause a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Best ball yet
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves to chew and has destroyed nearly a dozen balls over the past year. He rips off the fuzzy covers and shreds rubber toys. Leaving him alone with most toys, fabrics, plastic, and rubber items unsupervised is a mistake. The Kong ball, however, holds up well. It is heavy rubber, but withstands frequent chewing and can be left with him in his crate unsupervised.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to destroy
customer_reviews.text: This ball is not indestructible, but your dog will have to work very very hard to damage it. I purchased this 6 years ago and my dog still plays with this every week. I highly recommend this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Never Go Wrong With Kong
customer_reviews.text: I can never go wrong choosing KONG!! honestly!! My big dog is a HEAVY HEAVY CHEWER and Long and a couple other brands is all the choices I have in buying him toys. But, I'm sure not complaining as KONG RUBBER TOYS lasts so long! I have a KONG RUBBER you similar to this one I bought when my dog was 2 months old, he's now over a year old and the toy is still like new!! When it comes to KONG'S rubber toys... Honestly folks..there's not one thing I can say that I dislike about the product or products period. They are made JUST RIGHT!! #KONG #AMAZON
customer_reviews.author: Beck1500

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY but very durable ball. My ballcracker couldn't crack it
customer_reviews.text: Very well made but too heavy to throw indoors and my dog lost interest quickly. I have an 85lb 3yr old Danebull that we should've probably named Destructor. He can crack a tennis ball in half in less than a minute so I was looking for a good strong ball that he also couldn't destroy. This is it but he lost interest pretty quickly (probably because it's not fun if he can't destroy it). It's very heavy weighted. Could easily put a hole in your wall if you throw it hard. Great ball though, wish my dog still used it.
customer_reviews.author: kelly maisenbach

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy ball, my 70lb chewer hasn't been able to tear it up after months of play
customer_reviews.text: I was incredibly nervous about investing in new dog toys for my 15 month old, 70 pound labradane, Tolkien. He is a very enthusiastic chewer, and finds more joy in the destruction of an item than the chewing of it. For this reason, he has lost some interest in this ball, because it is still in one piece. =D I am really impressed, the teeth marks are minimal, the ball is sturdy, and he hasn't been able to tear any chunks off of it at all. I also purchased the tire, bone, and large kong treat dispenser, and they have held up just as well. The bone is definitely his favorite for playing tug of war.
customer_reviews.author: Ansley

customer_reviews.title: Best dog ball
customer_reviews.text: Kong has the absolute best toys for dog. My boy loves to play fetch. He destroys tennis balls and the like in hours. This kong ball bounces and is light weight and easy to throw far. Not to mention the size makes it easier to get out of my pups mouth. He does not like to drop it. Part of the game is getting it from him.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Kong extreme dog toys are the best
customer_reviews.text: It you are looking for a ball that will last, i suggest u buy a kong extreme ball. In my opinion, i think they are well worth the money. My dog likes to destroy his dog toys from time to time but he can never destory a kong extreme toy. If i buy him a regular kong toy (red color) he always manages to destroy it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M

customer_reviews.title: Super Tough Kong Ball
customer_reviews.text: My pit bull absolutely loves these Kong balls. He will destroy anything else very quickly. He is one of those dogs who is obsessed with balls and has it in his mouth mot of the time. He will even fall asleep with it in his mouth. if he hears something exciting outside, he will look around for his ball first and then go outside to check it out. I order several at a time so that we never run out. That would be a big problem. They are fairly expensive, but considering how tough they are and how long they last, I feel they are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Vada J. Graham

customer_reviews.title: I hated this ball !! It's SUPER heavy and hardly bounces at all!
customer_reviews.text: If your dog loves ball then the chuck it ultimate balls ( orange) work the best! I got this bc I like Kong products but this is a horrible " ball" it's more of a treat holder chew I guess- it won't bounce bc it's so heavy and would be like hitting my lab with a baseball if it contacted him ! Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: MtnBrookieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Treat Toy
customer_reviews.text: When we got our rescue dog, he was still a puppy and he went through several chew toys. After some research we came across the KONG Extreme Dog Toys and boy have these been a godsend. He can't chew through them! YAY! I was getting concerned that we wouldn't find anything that he could play with. These products keep him occupied for a while and gets some of that energy out. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: txgapeachy

customer_reviews.title: Withstands the Most Vigorous Chewing Assaults.
customer_reviews.text: The dog likes to play and he likes to chew on his toys. He's been trying to destroy the Kong Ball for two months with no success whatsoever. We play endless games of "fetch and catch" outdoors and more restrained games of "chew and catch" indoors and the ball withstands all assaults. It's his favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: MBT

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Kong Did Not Disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Could this be any heavier! The ball has not been chewed up by the worst of chewers. Unbelievable. It does the action of a fetch ball and I'm happy and so is Molly and Righley! Boy it's hard and heavy to throw. I've been buying balls for years and Kong balls are around but in different condition.
customer_reviews.author: Just ask me

customer_reviews.title: Meduim/large size perfect for our 75lb dog.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a couple of this kind of ball for dogs I've had in the past, and like the last one I bought this one does have a hole through the center. However, it's not big enough that our 75lb bloodhound mix has been able to damage it at all, and it's the perfect size for him. It's just larger than a standard tennis ball. Be aware that it is rather heavy for its size, but it bounces well which our dog loves, and is EXTREMELY durable. I'd highly recommend it if your dog is a strong chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica RileyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I love this and will buy alot more this size and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this and will buy alot more this size and a larger size. This is for dogs for 50 lbs not larger, but strong for our chewer worth the price and we are so very pleased. will update and say how long it will last but i feel it will last a long long time. update my 110 lb puppy hasn't destroyed it yet wow this is great, normally they last two seconds and this is his favorite next to his rope... will buy more of this but in a bigger size,
customer_reviews.author: Sharon-Lynn  NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great pitbull toy!
customer_reviews.text: Great pitbull toy! My dog usually shreds toys within five minutes. He loves this toy has been tossing it and chasing it all night! Not one didn’tgMy dog usually shreds toys within five minutes. He loves this toy has been tossing it and chasing it all night! Not one dent!! I must say I’m quite impressed
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Calvillo

customer_reviews.title: IF YOUR DOG IS A CHEWER, YOU NEED THIS
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my dog's favorite toy. It is durable and she plays with it a lot. Beware however of keeping it out at night. It makes a pretty good bonk when it hits a tile floor. Also, we lost one when she ran outside with it on one of her "necessary" trips. Check your dog's mouth before she leaves the building. We're on our second...Other products have failed to meet the CHEW endurance test...this one holds up. If your dog is a CHEWER you need this product. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Harris

customer_reviews.title: Puncture proof
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little (8-9 lb dog) heavy it is and It could bounce a little better But it does bounce.you can also put peanut butter or a treat in it as well....it is extremely durable, even my friends pit bull has one and she couldn’t puncture it...be careful in the house, this ball this has the potential of breaking something bc of the weight...I would still recommend for any aggressive chewer, big or small!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: If your dog destroys all toys, I would definitely give this a try!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, my dog usually destroys toys in a matter of minutes, so I didn't get my hopes up too much with this. BUT I was pleasantly surprised with this ball. It has been few months and this thing is still alive and without any damage actually. Pros: -super durable, its like a mini rubber bowling ball -it has this little hole in the center, you can put treats or some peanut butter. keeps them entertained for a while Cons: -the only con for me is the color, but thats just a personal thing. Sometimes its hard to see, if it gets stuck under a sofa or something like that.
customer_reviews.author: Marsh MallowTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Such a great toy.
customer_reviews.text: My dog and I love this ball. My coonhound mix is a serious chewer. He loves to chase and chew, chew, chew the ball to try and destroy it. Seriously, tries to destroy all balls. This one has lasted really well. It is finally starting to show some chew marks, but he has not been able to remove any chunks. He has destroyed sooo many balls and treat dispensing toys that I have lost count. He even destroyed the red Kong ball. But so far, this one is our favorite. I have ordered several to have on hand, but we are still on the first one.
customer_reviews.author: luebTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I’m always leary of dog toys that claim to be indestructible, because my dog will find a way to tear anything up! I have found that the only toys that stand up to her aggressive chewing is the Kong brand of toys. This ball is no exception. She’s had it for about 3 months now and I’ve watched her try to get a small tear started in order to begin the destruction, but it doesn’t happen. Of all the toys I’ve bought for her, the only ones that have survived are her Kong bone, ball and original Kong toy. They’re the best and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Breck Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Good strong ball.
customer_reviews.text: Great ball. Good for extreme chewer. High strung 80 lb GSD can squeeze the middle together "painful if your finger is in there", but after a few months of chewing and playing fetch, there are just a few little teeth marks in it. Seems like it will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Save your money if your dog is an intense chewer ...
customer_reviews.text: Save your money if your dog is an intense chewer! My dog did this after just an hour , a Nylabone is a MUCH safer option . The black Kong collection is supposed to be indestructible but clearly that isn't the case.
customer_reviews.author: Bess Ankrom

customer_reviews.title: Pittbull’s favorite...
customer_reviews.text: My dog destroys most every toy pretty quickly but these last a good long time. It is a heavy ball so we don’t play “catch” with it, but she’ll jaw on it for hours, retrieve it, play tug of war with it (slip rode thru hole), and can leave it with her with no fear of it being destroyed or eaten.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: The only toys we have now.
customer_reviews.text: After some less than pleasant experiences with rope toys, we only use kong extreme toys now. I have a pit-mix and a mini aussie, and they are both power chewers. They love these balls and so far have not been able to destroy them. There's always a chance they will, but for now these are good. We also have the kong extreme bone and those weirdly shape original kong toys. They're all pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for a heavy chewer.
customer_reviews.text: The Kong Extreme Ball works perfectly with our young poodle. She loves to chew and chews hard. So far, she has not managed to leave a mark on it despite chewing on it for hours. The ONLY drawback is the ball is heavy--when she drops it on my bare feet, it hurts. I recommend this ball for anyone who has a dog that loves to chew.
customer_reviews.author: David McGee

customer_reviews.title: Toys for aggressive chewers that last!
customer_reviews.text: I mentioned before that finding Kong products (from my local vet) was a revelation. My dog is an aggressive chewer. In other words, she will destroy and eat most chew toys in 20 minutes left to her own devices. If you are having similar issues or simply want the best bang for your buck, Kong is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves them- they seem incredibly durable. This is my 3rd order though because they end up in the lake- silly dog! They don't float and that's not a critique- for them to be as solid as to stand up to the Monster German Shepherd that plays with them, they need to be made this way. Until she looses one to the Lake monster, these show little to no wear despite all the fetch and bouncing. She'll keep losing them, and I'll keep replacing them. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: We've bought 3 so far because he does love them but for my extreme chewer they last longer ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this ball. It definetly holds up longer than most balls but it still only last him about a week before there are chunks on the ground and about 2 weeks before it's just a chunk. He's kind of a dick when it comes to playing fetch so he just gets free access to it all the time. He likes to toss it in the air and watch it bounce. We've bought 3 so far because he does love them but for my extreme chewer they last longer than others but still don't last.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a large for my small Boxer mix. It's much larger than a tennis ball and it has a hole through the middle to put treats. My Boxer doesn't care for this ball since it's so large and hard for him to hold onto, however, my 8lb dog loves this ball! She can't lift it, but loves to push it around and chew it. If you have a ball obsessed dog, they will love this. It's much heavier than I expected and makes a loud bang when dropped on the floor. We jokingly refer to this as the shot put toy.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: This is the first ball or any other chew toy that my pitbull cannot chew through. She may well do it eventually but this has lasted the longest. The only con is sometimes she is carrying it around and drops it and you do not want this ball dropping on your foot. It is very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs (yellow lab, and staffordshire terrier) LOVE this toy. The previous toys I’ve bought them they’d shred as soon as they got them. We’ve had this rubber ball for three weeks so far, and it’s still here holding up great. I bought three different durable dog toys on amazon at the same time, and this bouncy ball is both of theirs favorite. They always go running for this ball first. I’m ordering two more.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: A must have for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have a mini Australian Shepard. He may weigh 8 pounds and who knew something that small could be so destructive on toys. I have spent so much money on toys that he would rip to shreds in a day. I have purchased other Kong toys and he would tear those up also. I finally read somewhere that the black Kong toys were for aggressive chewers. This one is just a little big but he still is able to pick up and carry it around. I wish I had known about the black Kong products sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyd3838

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chewers
customer_reviews.text: Our lab mix and border collie love balls, but they tear them apart in minutes. I don’t like them eating the fuzz off of tennis balls, so we tried the Chuck-It balls that float. Those didn’t last either. I feel like this thing will go forever! It’s super heavy duty and bounces like a champ. Edit: tip - put it in a sock and tie a knot to keep it inside. Our dogs go CRAZY over the thing that way!
customer_reviews.author: DAVEandCOURTNEY WAYSONTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I think these are the best ball you can get your dog.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I actually just like it, but my dog loves it! If your dog shreds tennis balls the way mine does, get one of these Kong balls; they are incredibly durable. A couple warnings though: First, they are really dense and bounce surprisingly well--be careful how hard you throw it indoors if you have anything fragile on display (I managed to take a picture off the wall with it). Second, these balls roll much farther than you would expect, so be prepared to pull it out from behind doors, under furniture, etc. The red Kong ball is also great, and subject to the same warnings, but a powerful chewer will have a harder time destroying the black one.
customer_reviews.author: M. K.

customer_reviews.title: Yet to Destry
customer_reviews.text: First ball my dog has yet to shred. I have purchased several really expensive balls and other dog toys and my puppy destroyed them within an hour. He has spent several hours chewing this ball and after several weeks it only has a few teeth scratch marks on it. Amazingly enough it is still whole!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: indestructible Ball for sure
customer_reviews.text: I have a Pit bull, it destroys any air filled ball in less than 3 seconds. I even tried a basketball, it lasted only 5 seconds. I end up buying this Kong rubber ball., man this ball is not puncturable, real bouncy and has a hole for rope to go thru. Highly recommended., little pricey but this will last for ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh Sivaraman

customer_reviews.title: BEST TOY EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Bull Terrier would not survive without this ball. He's OBSESSED with it!! It's incredible the amount of focus he has on it, and will stare at it forever if he can't figure out how to get to it. It keeps him busy, and no treats are necessary, so no mess to clean up! I almost lost it twice, and truly didn't know what to do!! I'll be buying another, just to be safe. He can chew on this all day, and it barely has marks on it. Very well made, and will survive a tough chewer!
customer_reviews.author: jmac6

customer_reviews.title: If you have a power chewer, get this NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I reccomend this for any dog that is a power chewer. My 80lb pitbull can destroy any toy within minutes, except the Kong Extreme toys. If we play catch with any other ball, it gets shredded in less then 5 minutes into playing. This Kong ball allows us to olay fetch and for him to chew on it for hours and be just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Mindlessslumber

customer_reviews.title: No more eating tennis balls every week!
customer_reviews.text: Our "aggressive chewer" was eating every tennis ball we bought despite his begging to play fetch all the time. So I found this and it's been a money saver! It is a bit of a cannon ball though and knocked out a few of our fence boards that needed replacing anyway, lol! But with an adjustment to throwing differently and using the amazing bounce this has, it's been great. He catapults himself into the air to catch this thing and absolutely LOVES it. Highly recommended for similar situations.
customer_reviews.author: RMC

customer_reviews.title: So Far it's Indestructible!
customer_reviews.text: I have been through about 10 different brands of balls for my dog that claim to be indestructible. Every single one was destroyed within an hour, except for this one! I was originally concerned about the hole in the ball giving the dog a starting point for the destruction, but it has been over a month and there's barely even a mark on the ball! Highly recommend this toy if you have an aggressive chewer!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Kantar

customer_reviews.title: Dismayed at the new style - holes make it weaker
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an older Kong Extreme Ball that was lost. The older design was a solid ball, no holes. It was indestructible, at least by my dog, who played with it for 6 years. The holes in the new design give purchase to my dog's teeth and in one day he has gnawed some of the material away from the rim of the two holes. Please bring back the solid design, Kong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: We have had trouble finding toys for our 11 month old lab that he cannot destroy. So far so good this one has worked for the last 2 weeks -- longest ever for any toy! Its very hard, and we have to be careful when throwing it in the house as I can see this breaking something else. The treats slide out easily through the hole, so the treat doesn't last too long. Its not his favorite, but Im sure that's because he cant destroy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KONG Toys are the BEST
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 KONG Medium Large balls...two black and one red. We always have one available for play outside and my rescue dog loves to play ball. The reason we have 3 is due to the fact they can get lost in the house, under couches, beds, and who knows where.When no one wants to play in the house, he will stand at the top of the stairs and drop it and then chase it and start all over. We love all our KONG toys.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for those XL chewers!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing toy perfect for those mega chewers. I have a 10-month-old Irish Wolfhound who is 100lbs and growing fast. This guy is gentle, but when it's time to chew, he needs something durable-- I've watched him disassemble braided rope toys so they look like mops and he can bite a tennis ball in half within minutes. I needed something durable enough for his jaw that was safe from being swallowed. He went nuts just for the smell of the new rubber and loves how much he can throw the ball (more than the regular XL Kong we already have). Put a bit of peanut butter inside and he stays engaged for 30-40 minutes easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L

customer_reviews.title: Durable but heavy ball
customer_reviews.text: The ball is super durable. It’s a little heavier than I thought. Have to be careful not to hit the dog while throwing it or it could hurt him. However hopefully this ball will last and not breakdown and get torn up by our dog. I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative to the traditional tennis ball - squishy, bouncy, heavy, and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Durable, squishy, great weight to it with a good bounce, but you don't want a toddler throwing these around a TV or anything else that might be fragile. My German Shepherd loves them and they hold up great to his chewing. He tears through tennis balls in seconds so I thought I would give these a try. We bought two as add-on items for the price and are very happy we did. I just wish they were brightly colored, I keep losing them under the bed or the couch, or in a dark corner!!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Krava

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, indestructable
customer_reviews.text: Love this ball--if our dogs didn't loose it all the time under stuff or in the grass, it would be their favorite toy! Would love to see it in a bright orange or pink color so it can be seen in the yard. I tend to find it with the mower and have to jump off and save it from the blades :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Aggressive Chewers
customer_reviews.text: I don't believe there is actually any such thing as an indestructible dog toy, but these Kong balls come close. They are a great toy for the aggressive chewers, and fun for both the dog and you. Our dogs love these and I wouldn't purchase anything else.
customer_reviews.author: D Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible!
customer_reviews.text: My dog destroys most toys but he hasn't managed to destroy this yet! He is obsessed with any type of ball - tennis balls and this ball are his favorites. This is a rubber ball with a hole going through the center all the way through. This thing is heavy for a ball its size - be very careful throwing this around inside your house. We have broken a few glasses on the tile when the dog doesn't catch it on the first bounce but he absolutely loves he. He tries to chew it apart but its been 4 months and none of the rubber has budged. Great product and has made for a very happy pup!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: as good as it gets for a serious chewer
customer_reviews.text: great ball, lasts longer than others but still get chewed up in a a few months as our pit bull is obsessed with it.
customer_reviews.author: merryraye

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a few months now & it's still holding up! Very pleased with it. I was hesitant with the price but my dog destroys everything else within minutes (even when they say they're made for tough chewers) & his favorite type of toy is balls. If your dog is a heavy/strong chewer I recommend giving this a try.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves Ball! But one thing...
customer_reviews.text: FOUR AND A HALF STARS. Bunter goes nuts for his Kong Extreme Ball! He'll do anything to engage in a game of Nose It and Throw It. The missing half-star: my strong recommendation to the seller would be to offer this ball in a brighter color. The black Ball is too easily lost amid the shrubbery and when the sun goes down. We're on No. 3 in too short a time. Otherwise, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Not destroyed yet!
customer_reviews.text: Been two weeks and it's not destroyed. That's a huge bonus around here. My only regret is I didn't buy 7 of these! My dogs love it so much they keep hiding it from each other. When I say my dogs can destroy anything... They literally chewed through concrete. So far so good. And since its hidden at the moment I'll post a pic of the concrete eaters
customer_reviews.author: Jp0Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not indestructible
customer_reviews.text: I gave this ball 4 stars because I thought a Kong toy was truly indestructible....it's not. I've bought more toys over the last year since I got this pup than I've bought in a lifetime for all the dogs I've had just find something my Mastiff mix couldn't destroy within a couple hours. This Kong ball has been in his possession six days and is still around with just a few hinks missing. I don't know how much longer this ball will survive but for $6 it was worth it and he's LOVED it
customer_reviews.author: Ronee

customer_reviews.title: Great for stuffing, not so great for playing catch
customer_reviews.text: I like stuffing these with yogurt, pumpkin puree, or peanut butter, freezing them, and then giving them as a goodnight snack or to keep her busy when we have company over. Clean-up is easy: I just put mine in the dishwasher- they haven't broken down, even when using the high-temp/sanitize setting. I don't really think this is much different than the original Kong; it's kind of heavy so I wouldn't play catch with her using this (tennis ball works better), but it's tough and great for stuffing. Dog gets excited whenever she sees them. We've had ours about 6 months and she hasn't managed to destroy it yet. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Thank God
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this ball and it is a lifesaver. I have a pit bull/labrador one year old rescue and he went through toys that first week in an hour. I tried monster bones but it wasnt at all satisfying for him since it was like chewing a rock. He loves this ball its like a hunk of gum. It gives him that chew feeling but despite loads of expired energy he cannot destroy it at all. He loves it nd mama loves it because he is not chewing on my tots toys or anything else within reach. I highly recommend this ball. As a bouncy and fun toy chew.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenGreek

customer_reviews.title: Super duty but too heavy!
customer_reviews.text: If you want an indestructible ball this one is it!! It’s super heavy though & I’m a bit afraid of it bouncing off the ground and breaking our dogs tooth or busting her mouth open. I was afraid for it to be dropped on my bare foot it’s so heavy. Only giving 4 stars...
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Boston terrier a pack of tennis balls, which she loved and destroyed within 2 days. I bought a small, and it fits perfectly in her mouth. It doesn't have a squeaker, which is awesome because she plays with it through the night.
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: My great dane absolutely loves this toy and has yet to ruin it! Super durable, he plays with it for hours. I personally don't even have to put treats in it and he will still choose to play with this toy. Great brand, great product and I fully recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but apparently not so exciting.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this toy for about a year now and it's held up pretty well. Unfortunately, that may be in part because our pitbull/lab mix doesn't seem to pay it much attention, choosing instead to focus on the bigger toys he can pick up easier. We'll occasionally shove some carrots or other food inside of it which gets his attention for a little while, but we have other KONG toys with larger holes that we tend to use for that more often. All in all it is still a solid and durable toy, so I wouldn't want to dock it more than one star for what could just be our dog's preference.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: My lab loves her ball
customer_reviews.text: She goes to sleep with it and wakes up with it. She would come to me with the ball in her mouth wanting me to throw it. She constantly chews and plays with the ball on her own and it looks as if the ball is really holding up. Great buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Good chewer toy
customer_reviews.text: Have a super chewer pup who likes to play catch. However tennis balls don’t last 10 minutes with him. With this ball, he tries to chew and can’t . I’m sure if left alone for hours he would tear it apart but this should be used during play time .
customer_reviews.author: RJM 73

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I have a pit-lab and an aussie and they both have really strong jaws and tear up just about every toy in existence. I only buy them Kong toys now because they are the only ones durable enough for their strength! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: OLIVIA VIRES

customer_reviews.title: My dog Autumn says ten stars!
customer_reviews.text: Well, Autumn says to give it 10 stars - she adores this thing. Me, I'd give it two, because she wears me out wanting to play fetch with it all night long! But then again, seeing her so happy makes it worthwhile. Kong balls are the only ones that hold up; she chews up every other kind within hours, if not minutes. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Prisoner Of Hope

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Kong toys for heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: My 15 month old pittie mix could chew on it for 3-4 months before he would finally get some pieces off. It's the only Kong toy that he wouldn't destroy within 10 minutes or less. I would definitely recommend this ball if you have a dog that can eat everything.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Durable AF, my pitbull approves
customer_reviews.text: My pibble, Kaia, chews this even when she barks...yes it is possible! One of these will last her three months, give or take. That's eighty five days longer than any other "aggressive chewer" type toys available! It's a wonderful, tough toy for wonderful tough pups!
customer_reviews.author: H B.

customer_reviews.title: A fun and safe toy for extreme chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: Just added this to my girls toy box!! She's thrilled!! Only Kong toys for my extreme chewer. Other brands fall apart after 10 minutes with her mighty jaws and present choking hazzard and possible bowel obstruction if swallowed. Not Kong!! I feel safe giving her these toys. Thanks Kong!!
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: My black lab chews up everything. He's a big fan of this ball. But, whyyyyyyyyyyyy did it have to be black? My lawn mower has already found it once. Not the best color choice for a dog toy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Steinbacher

customer_reviews.title: Super quality and a happy dog!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog tears through tennis balls, even the Kong tennis balls, but this ball is so tough, she can’t destroy it. She loves it and will walk around with it all over the house..
customer_reviews.author: Karyn M

product_meta.title: KONG Extreme Ball Dog Toy
product_meta.description:
Size:Medium/Large| Color:BlackThe KONG Extreme Ball wins the fetching game for your dog! Durable, bouncy, natural KONG Extreme rubber gives it a bounce for fun games of fetch, delivering tons of healthy and interactive play.

Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.
feature_bullets: POWER CHEWING DOGS: The natural KONG Extreme black rubber formula is created to be very durable for power chewing dogs.
FETCH TOY: The extreme bounce makes this ball a great choice for fun games of fetch with lots of interactive play and exercise.
PUNCTURE RESISTANT: Your dog's health and safety is a primary concern at KONG. This toy is puncture resistant for continued safe play.
MEDIUM/LARGE DOGS: Made for medium or large dogs size 15-65 lbs (7-30 kg)
MADE IN THE USA. Globally Sourced Materials.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
